content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: would be nice for easy reverse clash ;v.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Ok problem.

Nice clash, and reverse is doable due to the limited options. 
Small typo: 'To HEAL, you must math the type' --> *match*.

Fun idea, but would be a bit hard to figure out on Reverse Mode especially for "ATTACK". It would be fine to keep it though.
(Goal)
- I did some line spacing to Goal. If you dislike it you can remove it.
- Please fix "... must match to the encounters' type."
- Please fix "math" to "match" or something.
- "Chose" to "Choose"
- "..., containing the [[kind]] and the [[type]] of the spell"
- Please use either "FRIEND" / "FOE" or "allies" / "opponents" to avoid ambiguous terms.
- Please use either ".. use the type..." or ".. choose the type" with same reason as above.
- Please use either [[types]] or [[type]] with same reason as above.
(Input)
- Please change [[opponent]] to [[encounter]], but either way I think it's a bit weird.
(Constaints)
- (Optional)
[[opponents]] must be {{FRIEND}} or {{FIRE}}
[[type]] must be {{FIRE}}, {{WATER}} or {{EARTH}}.

- I strongly suggest adding Example Explanation, but it's fine if you think it will make this clash too easy.
ty

Reverse mode is not adapted for this COC. You should uncheck the checkbox.
Otherwise, nice CoC !

Goal section
* Do you mean n encounters instead of n occurrences?

* Please include {{FRIEND}} and {{FOE}} in the statement.

Output section
* Please change "Line 1" to "[[n]] lines".

Constraints section
* Suggest to change the constraint to:
1 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 10

Thanks.

Thanks for the comment.
What is needed to adapt this for reverse mode?

I just did it without reading statement (to test 'reverse' mode) : with only the first 'Friendly Forest' and 'Dark Forest' tests you guess it and you already have all cases without need to investigate into next tests.
There is no need to adapt anything, it is easy to reverse it quickly as is.
